title: Six years on, time to stop playing
body:
So I've been playing League for quite a long time, had a few breaks here and there but it's been about five or six years since I played for the first time, started off pre season one and played since then. Spent about 3-400 dollars on this game too.

Just logged in today to play a game after a hard days work and the new UI is so nauseating I've uninstalled.

I might be back when there's a resolution to this, in the meantime I'm researching UI skins, 

At present this one's not looking too bad
http://leaguecraft.com/uimods/2673-classic-gold.xhtml

Anyone else decided to take a break?

replies.body:
Just give your eyes and brain time to adjust, you dont realise how much you use your eyes and brain when playing this game, a difference like a new hud can be a little over whelming. 

If you quit a game because of this then you shouldnt play a game, because if something this small outweighs the pros of playing this game then you obviously never liked league in the firs tplace

or your just throwing a hissy fit in hopes of league changing it back (which wont happen).

FYI. There was 20-30x more positive feedback then negative feedback after the first week on PBE servers, concerning the new hud
I was on Reddit and I found this... http://imgur.com/W66dfcx
No, we just need to adjust

Yeah I like season 4 classic map with HUD for a few reasons:

- Less eye strain
- More fps because of less gloss on the map
- Far more clarity of information
i cant play because i crash every 5 minutes in game because of this patch so it might just be time to take a break
